column2: Throwing the exception variable will lose the original stack information. This can make errors harder to diagnose.
Catching all exceptions with a generic catch clause may be overly broad, which can make errors harder to diagnose.
An assignment to a local variable that is not used later on, or whose value is always overwritten, has no effect.
column4: This assignment to [["streamFileInput"|"relative:///CWE397_Throw_Generic_Exception__throw_Exception_01.cs:21:37:21:51"]] is useless, since its value is never read.
